 Displays an error, running as a modal sheet on the receiver's main window.  This method returns immediately.  Control flows to the modal delegate's didEndSelector when the user clicks the button, unless these parameters are nil, then the sheet itself terminates the process.

Detailed Description

BookMacster's default Document. A "Bookshelf" is a place for storing bookmarks in a given configuration.

Considered using just one notification instead of seven, using userInfo to identify which timestamp to update. But since I need to coalesce on name to reduce the number of notifications, this would, for example, coalesce 'sorted' and 'unsorted' into one notification instead of having the 'unsorted' be first in/out of the queue and 'sorted' last in/out of the queue as desired.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) addOrRemoveStarkPerValueOfHasForSharype: (Sharype)  sharype  

Reads the current value of hasBar, hasMenu, hasUnfiled or hasOhared for the receiver's shig, compares this to whether or not the receiver's managed object context actually has the relevant stark, and if necessary adds or deletes the relevant stark so that it actually has what the shig says it's supposed to have or not have.

If a stark with children is removed, an error is logged.

Parameters:
sharype The sharype of the stark to be possibly added or removed. Must be one of SharypeBar, SharypeMenu, SharypeUnfiled or SharypeOhared.

- (SSYAlert *) alert  

Returns the receiver's main window's alert sheet.

General document-wide processes such as internalizing, externalizing, sorting, finding duplicates should display modal alerts, if desired, on the document's main window, accessing it via this method.

- (Stark *) defaultParentForStark: (Stark*)  item  

Returns the default parent which should adopt a give stark that cannot be adopted by its desired parent.

Parameters:
item The proposed child

- (Dupetainer*) dupetainer  

Fetches the single instance of the 'dupetainer' managed object from the receiver's managed object context.

The document's 'dupetainer' is the Container of Duplicate Groups.

- (void) findDupes  

If findDupes is necessary, finds duplicates among the receiver's starks, obeying the duplicate-finding rules given in the receiver's shig.

Necessity is determined by comparing the timestamps lastDupesDone and lastDupesMaybeMore of the receiver's shig.

Works in another thread, after all pre-existing operations in the process' common operation queue have been completed.

- (void) runModalAlertSheetWithIconStyle: (NSInteger)  iconStyle
modalDelegate: (id)  delegate
didEndSelector: (SEL)  didEndSelector 

Runs an alert as a modal sheet on the receiver's main window.  This sheet is the one that was previously accessed and configured with -alert.  This method returns immediately.

This method is actually just a wrapper which sends runModalSheetOnWindow:modalDelegate:didEndSelector:contextInfo: to the receiver's main window's alert. See documentation of -[BookshelfChildWindowController runModalAlertSheetWithIconStyle:modalDelegate:didEndSelector:] for requirements on arguments.

- (void) saveMoveToNewPath: (NSString*)  newPath  

An action item which produces an Open panel in which the user can rename or relocate the receiver.

Sends the receiver a -setFileURL: message and also saves the file.  Displays alert dialog if any error.

- (Bookshig*) shig  

Fetches the single instance of the 'shig' managed object from the receiver's managed object context.

The document's 'shig' is a container for all of the "internal metadata"; everything except the starks.

- (void) sort  

If sorting is necessary, sorts all of the receiver's starks, obeying sorting rules given in the receiver's shig.

Necessity is determined by comparing the timestamps lastSortDone and lastSortMaybeNot of the receiver's shig.
